Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Mitral Valve Repair vs. Replacement for Severe Ischemic Mitral Regurgitation

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included severe ischemic mitral regurgitation, and the study was conducted across multiple cardiothoracic centers.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the recurrence of moderate/severe mitral regurgitation or death within 2 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment ensured.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the interventions.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 116 patients who received repair, 76 developed moderate/severe mitral regurgitation or died.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Of the 116 patients who received repair, 76 developed moderate/severe mitral regurgitation or died.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were not detailed in the abstract.
